intro: Cupaniopsis punctulata, commonly known as the Australian hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Cupaniopsis punctulata is often used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
